definition: namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement

sentences.english: The oboist is well known for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 这位双簧管吹奏者以即兴演奏而著名。

sentences.english: Purna Yoga is an improvisation of the traditional systems of Yoga.
sentences.chinese: 整体瑜伽是传统瑜伽体系的即兴创作。

sentences.english: This white-knuckle improvisation was evident across Wall Street, too.
sentences.chinese: 这种充满刺激的即兴行为也明显影响到华尔街。

sentences.english: The non-profit organization's approach is improvisational and personal.
sentences.chinese: 非盈利组织的方法很即兴和亲自的。

sentences.english: Theory, Aural, Technique, Song Writting, Improvisation Ideas.
sentences.chinese: 乐理，听力，技术，作曲，即兴。

sentences.english: In Chinese, often with text content impromptu performance figures.
sentences.chinese: 语文课上，常常即兴配合课文内容进行人物表演。

sentences.english: The lines are different, depending on how each and everyone improvises .
sentences.chinese: 台词不尽相同，如何演绎，则在于个人即兴创作。

sentences.english: As an actor, do you get to suggest bits of dialogue or do some improv?
sentences.chinese: 作为演员，你会主动商榷台词或做些即兴表演吗？

sentences.english: His grandfather noticed that he would often improvise melodies as he played with his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父注意到他在玩玩具时常常即兴哼出旋律来。

sentences.english: The actress forgot her lines and had to extemporize .
sentences.chinese: 那个女演员忘了台词，只好即兴表演。

sentences.english: The guitar player gave a fantastic solo during the riffage.
sentences.chinese: 那个吉他手在即兴演奏中的独奏部分表现十分出色。

sentences.english: I would sing to her and try and get all her riffs and stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我会跟着她的专辑唱歌，试着学她的即兴演唱和素材。

sentences.english: His long, improvised dirges will ring forever in my ears.
sentences.chinese: 他长篇与即兴的哀歌将永远回绕于我的耳际。

sentences.english: CFI is an organization and platform for China's free improvisational music.
sentences.chinese: CFI是一个关于中国即兴音乐的组织和平台。

sentences.english: The site doesn t have a logo, so you should improvise one.
sentences.chinese: 该网站没有按T有一个标志，所以你应该即兴之一。

definition: to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
to add to the fun/to liven things up
to perform on a musical instrument
